thread.title: Peoria police release 911 call of woman shot in face during attempted carjacking
thread.title_full: Peoria police release 911 call of woman shot in face during attempted carjacking

author: Logan Newman
title: Peoria police release 911 call of woman shot in face during attempted carjacking
text:
Peoria police release 911 call of woman shot in face during attempted carjacking Logan Newman , The Republic | azcentral.com 6:23 p.m. MT Feb. 21, 2017 CLOSE x Share Police are looking for five people in connection with the shooting and attempted carjacking of a woman who was playing Pokemon Go outside Peoria City Hall early Feb. 18, 2017. Peoria Police Department Surveillance video shows an attempted carjacking in a parking lot outside of the Peoria Municipal Complex. (Photo: Peoria Police Department) 84 CONNECT 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
A 63-year-old woman who was shot during an attempted carjacking in a parking lot outside the Peoria Municipal Complex early Saturday morning was approached by as many as five teenagers, Peoria police said Tuesday. 
The woman was playing Pokemon Go on her cellphone around 2:30 a.m., according to police documents. 
The woman told police she was approached by a 17- or 18-year-old who asked for directions. Surveillance video shows he was accompanied by four other people, police said. 
The woman only saw three others, according to police documents. Two approached her vehicle and one remained near the back. 
As the woman began talking to the person who asked her for directions, he pulled out a pistol and told her to exit her car, police said. She tried to drive away and was shot in the face. 
She managed to drive several blocks and then called the police, according to police documents. Police released her 911 call, in which she can be heard speaking slowly to a dispatcher, saying she had been shot. The dispatcher keeps her on the line for details while help is sent to her location. 
The woman was taken to a hospital in critical condition but is expected to survive. 
Peoria police ask anyone with information to contact the department at at 623-773-8311 or Silent Witness at 480-WITNESS. 84 CONNECT 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://azc.cc/2lt0qzn TOP VIDEOS
